intro: Passiflora stipulata, commonly known as the stipulate passionflower, is a climbing vine native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, complex flowers that feature a crown of filaments and a central cluster of stamens. The plant produces edible, orange-yellow berries that are rich in vitamin C. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with stipules at the base, contributing to its common name. Passiflora stipulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
